summary: The House is one of the two parts of the U.S. Congress, with 435 voting members and some non-voting delegates. It creates and passes federal laws, especially those about money. Representatives are elected every two years, ensuring direct representation of the people. The number of representatives per state is based on population. Initially, only some people could vote, but this has expanded over time. The House is led by the Speaker, and its rules are designed for a two-party system.
title: United States House of Representatives
